boone

Class NeuralNet

  • java.lang.Object
    • boone.NeuralNet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Storable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SpikingNeuralNet

    public class NeuralNet
extends java.lang.Object
implements Storable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Central class for Boone. Holds the neurons, links, trainers and other things of a neural network. Use NetFactory to create NeuralNets conveniently.
    Version:
    $Id: NeuralNet.java 2294 2016-04-18 11:38:16Z helmut $
    Author:
    August Mayer, Helmuit A. Mayer

        The maximal number of cycles

      • zeroInputAfterFirstCycle

        protected boolean zeroInputAfterFirstCycle
        Reset the external input of the input neurons to zero after the first cycle when innervating the network? Probably only useful for recurrent networks, where the internal per-neuron feed-back should take over (see Neuron.loopOutputToInput).

        Default: false.

      • filter

        protected IOFilter filter
        The IO filter.

      • calcOrder

        protected int calcOrder
        Calculation order for this neural network. Can be one of those: 0 = ORDER_TOPO, sorts the neurons in topological order before calculating the network result; this doesn't work for recurrent networks 1 = ORDER_RANDOM, uses single updates in random order, where the updates are effective immediately. 2 = ORDER_STEP, calculates each neuron using the old values of the surrounding parts.

      • ORDER_TOPO

        public static final int ORDER_TOPO
        Constant for the calcOrder field. 0 = ORDER_SORTED, sorts the neurons into the correct update order before calculating the network result; this doesn't work for recurrent networks.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ORDER_RANDOM

        public static final int ORDER_RANDOM
        Constant for the calcOrder field. 1 = ORDER_RANDOM, uses single updates in random-order, where the updates are effective immediately, or
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ORDER_STEP

        public static final int ORDER_STEP
        Constant for the calcOrder field. 2 = ORDER_STEP, calculates each neuron using the old values of the surrounding parts.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • addNeuron

        public void addNeuron(Neuron neuron)
        Add a neuron to our list. Specifically, adds the neuron to the internal neuron list, and to the input and/or output neuron lists if the neuron is an input/output neuron.
        Parameters:
        neuron - the neuron to add

      • replaceNeuron

        public void replaceNeuron(Neuron oldNeuron,
                          Neuron newNeuron)
        Replace a neuron with another. The neuron is also disconnected and re-connected in all links. All links of the old neuron are added to the new neuron. If the old neuron is the same as the new neuron (w.r.t. ==), does nothing.

      • removeNeuron

        public boolean removeNeuron(Neuron neuron)

        Returns:

      • replaceLink

        public void replaceLink(Link oldLink,
                        Link newLink)
        replace a link with another. The neuron is also disconnected and re-connected in all links. Finally, the old neuron's outputLinks and inputLinks lists are cleared.

        NOTE: The solution may look a bit complicated, but this is prepared for Special, extended links.

      • removeLink

        public boolean removeLink(Link link)
        remove a link from our network.

        NOTE: The Link is always disconnected before removing from the neurons using Link.disconnect() .

        Also please note that there is no removeLink(int index) method, because the link needs to be looked up anyway, to disconnect it.

        Returns:
        whether the link was found in our list of links.
        See Also:
        Link.disconnect()

        Extract the output pattern from the network.
        Parameters:

      • randomize

        public void randomize()
        Randomizes the network parameters to some meaningful values. Also resets the TickList.

      • createTickList

        protected NeuronList createTickList()
        Creates a tick list according to the set ordering. If topological ordering is not possible, a null list is returned. If 'calcOrder' has an undefined value, a random tick list is created.
        Returns:
        a tick list, null, if problems

      • innervate

        public void innervate()
        innervate the network, i.e. tick() all the neurons of the current tickList.

        This method works as follows:

        • Call createTickList() if no cached tick list, or if random calc order is selected.
        • Loop for maxCycles cycles.
          • call innervateCycle.
        • Reset the neuron link input values to zero.
        For recurrent networks using the loopOutputToInput functionality (such as Hopfield Networks), please note that it is not possible to continue the innervation for more cycles by simply calling this method again. For one, a different calc order will be generated if the default ORDER_RANDOM calcOrder is used; moreover, the link inputs, and with them the neuron back-loops, will have been cleared. If you need this, please examine the innervateCycle() method.

      • innervateCycle

        protected void innervateCycle(int cycle)
        Perform a single network innervation cycle. Please see innervate() for normal usage; this method is only useful for special use cases, for example when network evaluation needs to be closely tracked, or if it should be possible to continue network innervation.

        In more detail, this method does the following things:

        • Go through the whole tick list, call calculate for each tick-able and, if not using step update order, also call Neuron.propagateOutput().
        • If step update order is used, go through the whole tick list again and tick the neurons.
        • Set the external input of all input neurons to zero after the first cycle, if zeroInputAfterFirstCycle is enabled.
        Parameters:
        cycle - the current cycle (starting with 0)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        convert the net to a string (multi-line).
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • setTrainer

        public void setTrainer(Trainer trainer)
        Assigns a trainer to the network and prepares the network for training. Note that any subsequent changes to the network (by the user) may result in an incorrect training. If you have to change the network, then you must set the trainer again in order to achieve a correct training regime.
        Parameters:
        trainer - the trainer

      • replaceTrainer

        public void replaceTrainer(Trainer trainer)
        Deprecated. use #setTrainer instead set a network trainer. This also sets trainer.net to this instance.

        NOTE: This method also changes the PartTrainers of all neurons and links to ones freshly created using Trainer.createPartTrainer !! If you don't want that, use setTrainer(boone.Trainer).

      • getTrainer

        public Trainer getTrainer()
        Returns:
        the current network trainer.

      • getMaxCycles

        public int getMaxCycles()
        Returns:
        the maximum number of cycles (iterations) per turn.

      • setMaxCycles

        public void setMaxCycles(int maxCycles)
        Parameters:
        maxCycles - the maximum number of cycles (iterations) per turn.

      • setZeroInputAfterFirstCycle

        public void setZeroInputAfterFirstCycle(boolean makeZero)
        Define whether to reset the external input of the input neurons to zero after the first cycle when innervating the network. This is useful for recursive networks.

        Default: false, i.e. do not reset to zero.

      • getZeroInputAfterFirstCycle

        public boolean getZeroInputAfterFirstCycle()
        Return whether the NeuralNet zeroes out the external input of the input neurons after the first evaluation cycle.

      • getTickList

        public NeuronList getTickList()
        Return the tickList. Needed e.g. for backprop trainers, because they have to propagate backward.
        Returns:
        the current tickList, or null.

      • setTickList

        public void setTickList(NeuronList tickList)
        Parameters:
        tickList - A new tick list, maybe resorted, that will be used until the next update. Use null to have a new tickList automatically calculated during the next innervate().

      • getCalcOrder

        public int getCalcOrder()
        Returns:
        Value of property calcOrder.

      • setCalcOrder

        public void setCalcOrder(int calcOrder)
        Sets the order of calculation of neurons.
        Parameters:
        calcOrder - the calc order

      • isFeedForward

        public boolean isFeedForward()
        Checks, if the network is a feed-forward network. This method performs a fresh assignment of layer numbers, even though they already may have correct ones.
        Returns:
        true, if feed-forward

      • load

        public static NeuralNet load(java.io.File file,
                             IOFilter filter)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Loads a NeuralNet from the given file using the set file filter. If loading is successful, the given filter is attached to the net. Do not forget to configure the filter for the correct state of compression of the file to be loaded.
        Parameters:
        file - file to load the network from
        Returns:
        this neural network, null if problems
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        Save a NeuralNet to the given file, in the Boone XNet format, using the IOFilter class.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • clone
